page.title: 18THE A2 ROAD
page.content: The A2 road was a main route from Dover to London before the M2 motorway was built. Although the amount of traffic that uses the A2 is less, on busy days the road is used by at least 1000 vehicles of all types per hour. Bapchild village was originally built on each side of this old Roman road but building development has taken place on the south west side. This development consists of a small number of Council owned properties and a larger private estate. When road works are being carried out on the approach to Sittingbourne the road through Bapchild is often filled with traffic waiting to enter the town.
